author: Slidebean
description:
Elon’s “truthful” Wikipedia just launched : meet Grokpedia.

xAI just flipped the switch on Grokpedia, an AI written encyclopedia with 885,000 articles at launch.
Elon calls it a “more truthful” alternative to Wikipedia, but it’s not editable, and it’s fact checked by Grok.
Some entries already include false claims about AIDS and social media.
So far, it seems like Grokpedia tells the truth, as Elon sees it.

👉Hear the full breakdown on The Slidebean Stand-Up; streaming now on Spotify, Apple Podcasts, and all major podcast platforms.
title: Elon made his own Wikipedia

author: Slidebean
description:
The FTC just deleted its own AI warnings.

The U.S. government’s AI watchdog quietly erased several blog posts warning about AI risks, no notice, no explanation.
The deleted posts covered open source dangers and the rush to deploy unsafe tools.
These weren’t laws, but companies used them to gauge what regulators might enforce.
Now they’re gone and so is the public record of how the FTC viewed AI.
 
 👉Hear the full breakdown on The Slidebean Stand-Up; streaming now on Spotify, Apple Podcasts, and all major podcast platforms.
title: The FTC quietly removed key AI guidance

author: Slidebean
description:
Amazon’s cutting jobs again. This time, AI’s to blame.

Amazon plans to lay off up to 30,000 corporate employees in its latest cost cutting move.
CEO Andy Jassy says generative AI is driving the shift, right before the holidays.
The irony? An MIT study found that over 90% of corporate AI projects fail to save money, and often cost more.

👉Hear the full breakdown on The Slidebean Stand-Up; streaming now on Spotify, Apple Podcasts, and all major podcast platforms.
title: AI’s replacing job  but not saving money
